alert.note: Alert for Lake; Mendocino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 14 at 6:51AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central California and northwest California, including the following counties, in central California, Lake. In northwest California, Mendocino. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 651 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lakeport, Point Arena, Middletown, Clearlake, Knobcone Camp, Hopland, Finley, North Lakeport, Soda Bay, Mount Konocti, Konocti Bay, Hobergs, Loch Lomond, Adams, Glenhaven, Forest Lake, Whispering Pines, Ettawa Springs, Seigler Springs and Anderson Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
